ValueDomain.preferredName: Inclusion Exclusion Criterion Test Code Clinical Study Sponsor Defined Identifier
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A character or string that represents the short code name of the inclusion exclusion criterion test._An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]_Clearly characterized or delimited._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ReferenceDocuments.name: What was the identifier of th
ReferenceDocuments.description: What was the identifier of the inclusion criterion the subject did not meet or the exclusion criterion the subject met?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: This field is required to appear on the CRF, but may be null if there are no exceptions to the inclusion/exclusion criteria. The CRF should allow multiple exceptions to be recorded. See SDTMIG V3.2 Section 7.5.2 for assumptions regarding protocol versioning. Sponsor may provide a list of inclusion/ exclusion criteria and the unique identifying codes to the site. The list provided should be versioned/updated when the protocol changes and the criteria are changed. Sponsor should use sponsor developed controlled terminology for IETESTCD.

ReferenceDocuments.name: IETESTCD
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the subject was not eligible, Record the identifying code for each criterion that was an exception.
